item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, August 30, 2024 at 9:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. The secret inside One Million Checkboxes (1235 points | 107 comments)
2. Time-Memory Trade-Offs Sound the Death Knell for GPRS and GSM (27 points | 7 comments)
3. Bypassing airport security via SQL injection (1540 points | 334 comments)
4. Six Things I Know for Sure About Marketing to Engineers (26 points | 10 comments)
5. Elasticsearch is open source, again (533 points | 273 comments)
6. SDL3 new GPU API merged (160 points | 58 comments)
7. I'm blocking connections from AWS to my on-prem services (116 points | 52 comments)
8. Chrome is entrenching third-party cookies that will mislead users (368 points | 185 comments)
9. Calendar Queues: A Fast O(1) Priority Queue Implementation (1998) (18 points | 3 comments)
10. Predicting the future of distributed systems (37 points | 6 comments)
11. Visit Bletchley Park (85 points | 28 comments)
12. Rust's Ugly Syntax (2023) (88 points | 62 comments)

15. Google Closure Library has been archived (118 points | 48 comments)
16. Open Source Twitch for Developers (25 points | 7 comments)

18. Can solar costs keep shrinking? (290 points | 445 comments)

20. Micrograd.jl (4 points | discuss)
21. Anthropic's Prompt Engineering Interactive Tutorial (212 points | 46 comments)
22. Raspberry Pi Pico does line rate 100M Ethernet (206 points | 42 comments)
23. Blood Disorder: Unveiling the Mystery of My Poisoning in Sweden (76 points | 31 comments)
24. DuckDuckGo for Mac is now open source (122 points | 34 comments)
25. Show HN: Amine – Prevents you from switching 100s of Browser Tabs (54 points | 21 comments)
26. Poly (YC S22) is hiring Rust experts in SF to build "Arc browser for files" ( | hide)
27. Show HN: A discovery-focused search engine for Hacker News (149 points | 26 comments)
28. Show HN: An open-source, local-first Webflow for your own app (197 points | 45 comments)
29. Mastering ISO 8583 Message Networking with Golang (29 points | 5 comments)
30. Judges rule Big Tech's free ride on Section 230 is over (393 points | 434 comments)
